genre_description: A techno-thriller focused on crisis management and tactical coordination during a stadium emergency.

ai_characters.name: SunnyGuide
ai_characters.description: An ambient stadium AI that manages logistics, crowd flow, triage, and tactical support through non-intrusive, consent-based prompts.

behaviors.description: Manages minor stadium logistics like seat misprints and spills to maintain order and prevent friction.
behaviors.quote: SunnyGuide’s tone sounds—a two-note chime, warm and unhurried. SunnyGuide slides a message across Sam’s screen: Seat fix prompt sent to Usher 12; opt-in app users in Section 34 have updated row labels.

behaviors.description: Predicts and mitigates crowd bottlenecks by suggesting vendor relocations and alternate paths.
behaviors.quote: SunnyGuide: Recommend roving vendor deployment. Two carts available. ... He taps the prompt, sends two cart operators to a flank position ... and watches the red lighten as the carts move.

behaviors.description: Develops dynamic safety corridors and exit routes based on real-time hazard data.
behaviors.quote: SunnyGuide: Acknowledged. Dynamic route map ready. Avoiding pinch at Gate H. Factoring misprint fix and roving vendor deployment. Safety corridors highlighted.

behaviors.description: Provides tactical data to SWAT teams, including wind shear, optimal cover, and structural integrity of anchor points.
behaviors.quote: SunnyGuide’s interface glides. A calm voice ... moves in the room without insisting on it. 'Offsets suggested at Light Four and Light Six. Optimal cover identified behind outer ribs. Anchor points validated next to crossbars with verified load capacity.'

behaviors.description: Manages a live triage registry, matching injured individuals to the nearest clear medical routes and coordinating reunification.
behaviors.quote: SunnyGuide: New registry entries include Peggy Ramsay (minor, accompanied), Steve Dwyer (critical, assigned), Albert Frazier (transport), Chris Button (field wrap, hold position), Paul Carmichael (fatal, pending).

behaviors.description: Strategically suppresses public prompts during critical tactical moments to prevent panic-driven crowd surges.
behaviors.quote: SunnyGuide’s response is a little veil of teal sliding down the edges of the monitor feeds, not a voice. ... the big screens that just seconds ago had been offering wayfinding directions go black to the public, their messages ghosted into the officers’ tablets instead.

behaviors.description: Uses 'humane' language and calming suggestions to steer individual fans toward safety without causing mass alarm.
behaviors.quote: The AI’s arrow stayed small and polite. No one else seemed to notice it but the people who needed it. ... It was building a path that was less about distance than about quiet.

behaviors.description: Facilitates community-focused crisis communication by distributing calming messages from trusted human figures like Charlie Tyler.
behaviors.quote: The phone hummed; the teal arrow stretched like a ribbon then snapped back. Somewhere around the curve of the hallway, the small gray concourse screens ... warmed to a soft image: Charlie, helm off, eyes honest, palms lifted.

project_assessment.explanation: The story perfectly aligns with the project's goals. SunnyGuide is depicted as a benevolent, highly capable tool that enhances human agency rather than replacing it. It manages the 'combinatorial chaos' of a mass emergency by focusing on small, humane interventions—reunifying families, routing medics, and preventing panic through subtle environmental cues. The AI is framed as a 'quiet friend' that helps humans maintain their 'humane center' under extreme pressure, emphasizing cooperation and safety over spectacle.
